sen.j: 御料所（ごりょうしょ）とは、料所（りょうしょ）・御料（ごりょう）とも呼ばれ、天皇（皇室）及び幕府などのいわゆる「公儀」と称される公権力が直接支配した土地（直轄地）。
sen.e: Goryosho, which is also called Ryosho or Goryo, is the land under the direct control of the official authority such as Emperor (Imperial family) or Shogunate.
Goryosho, which is also called ryosho or goryo, is the land under the direct control of an official authority such as the Emperor (the Imperial family) or Shogunate.
sen.cmt: ryosho or goryo の語頭を小文字に修正し、 Imperial family を the Imperial family に修正しました。他数か所修正しました。
sen.e: Goryosho, which is also called ryosho or goryo, is the land under the direct control of an official authority such as the Emperor (the Imperial family) or Shogunate.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 家臣に与えられた所領（知行地）に対する概念でもある。
sen.e: Goryosho is different from the fee (chigyo-chi) feoffed to feudatory.
Goryosho is different from a territory (chigyo-chi) feoffed to a feudatory.
sen.cmt: the fee' は法律用語のため、一般的な 'territory' に変更しました。a を追記しました。
sen.e: Goryosho is different from a territory (chigyo-chi) feoffed to a feudatory.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: なお、『日葡辞書』においては、「王位に付属する領地、すなわち、国王の私有の領地や土地」と定義している。
sen.e: "Nippo Jisho" (Japanese-Portuguese dictionary) defines Goryosho as royal estates, or a king's private demesne and land.
"Nippo Jisho" (Japanese-Portuguese dictionary) defines goryosho as royal estates, or a king's private demesne and land.
sen.cmt: goryosho の語頭を小文字に修正ました。
sen.e: "Nippo Jisho" (Japanese-Portuguese dictionary) defines goryosho as royal estates, or a king's private demesne and land.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 守護大名や戦国大名の蔵入地や、江戸幕府の公儀御料（明治以後は天領）も御料所の一種である。
sen.e: Goryosho includes a directly controlled lands of shugo daimyo (feudal lords) and of Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lords in the Sengoku period) and Imperial property (tenryo, a shogunal demesne after Meiji era) that the Edo shogunate owned.

Goryosho includes lands controlled directly by Shugo daimyo (feudal lords) and by Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lords in the Sengoku period) and lands controlled directly by the Edo shogunate (known as tenryo after Meiji era).
sen.cmt: a directly controlled lands of を lands controlled directly by に変更しました。Shugo daimyo の頭文字を大文字に修正しました。'Imperial property that the Edo shogunate owned' だと江戸幕府所有の「天皇」領となるため、directly controled lands that the Edo shogunate owned としました。また、同じものを指して、明治以降は天皇領となったため、tenryoと呼ばれるようになったと（）内を変更し訳出しました。
sen.e: Goryosho includes lands controlled directly by Shugo daimyo (feudal lords) and by Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lords in the Sengoku period) and lands controlled directly by the Edo shogunate (known as tenryo after Meiji era).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、天皇の御料地を特に禁裏御料あるいは皇室御領と称する場合もある。
sen.e: Emperor's goryochi is sometimes called Kinrigoryo or Imperial family's domains.
Also, the Emperor's goryochi (an Imperial estate) is sometimes called Kinrigoryo or Koshitsugoryo.
sen.cmt: Also を追記しました。(an Imperial estate) を初出のため追記しました。 Imperial family's domains を Koshitsugoryo に変更しました。
sen.e: Also, the Emperor's goryochi (an Imperial estate) is sometimes called Kinrigoryo or Koshitsugoryo.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: なお、実際には家臣などを代官として支配・経営させている場合も多く、実態としては朝廷や幕府を本所や本家あるいは領家とした荘園に近い形態であったとも考えられている。
sen.e: In many cases Goryosho was actually controlled and run by local governors and was almost like a manor where Imperial Court and Shogunate took the place of honjo (the administrative headquarters of manor) or of Honke, the head family (the owner of the highest-graded patches of land under the stratified land ruling structure of Shoen) or of ryoke (virtual proprietor of manor.)

In many cases Goryosho was actually controlled and run by local governors and was almost like a manor where Imperial Court and Shogunate took the place of honjo (the administrative headquarters of manor) or of Honke, the head family (the owner of the highest-graded patches of land under the stratified land ruling structure of Shoen) or of ryoke (virtual proprietor of manor.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In many cases Goryosho was actually controlled and run by local governors and was almost like a manor where Imperial Court and Shogunate took the place of honjo (the administrative headquarters of manor) or of Honke, the head family (the owner of the highest-graded patches of land under the stratified land ruling structure of Shoen) or of ryoke (virtual proprietor of manor.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 室町幕府も50ヶ所近い御料所（公方御料）を保持して、直臣の奉公衆・奉行衆を代官として派遣して納めさせていた。
sen.e: The Muromachi shogunate, which owned approx. fifty Goryosho (kubo goryo), delegated control of Goryosho to great vassals, such as hokoshu (the shogunate military guard) or bugyoshu and made them pay tax to the shogunate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Muromachi shogunate, which owned approximately fifty goryosho (kubogoryo), delegated control of goryosho to great vassals, such as hokoshu (the shogunate military guard) or bugyoshu (group of magistrates) and made them pay tax to the shogunate.
sen.cmt: approx. を approximately に、Goryosho を goryosho に、kubo goryo を kubogoryo に修正しました。(group of magistrates) を追記しました。
sen.e: The Muromachi shogunate, which owned approximately fifty goryosho (kubogoryo), delegated control of goryosho to great vassals, such as hokoshu (the shogunate military guard) or bugyoshu (group of magistrates) and made them pay tax to the shogunate.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ところが戦乱が相次いだことで経営は不安定であり、次第に京都の商工業から挙がる税収に依存するようになる。
sen.e: However, the Muromachi shogunate became to count more and more on tax revenues from the merchants in Kyoto rather than from Goryosho, due to the poor and unsteady business performance of goryosho caused by the maelstrom of wars.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, the Muromachi shogunate came to count more and more on tax revenues from the merchants in Kyoto rather than from goryosho, due to the poor and unsteady business performance of goryosho caused by a wave of wars.
sen.cmt: became を came に修正しました。1番目の Goryosho を goryosho に修正しました。maelstrom of を a wave of に修正しました。
sen.e: However, the Muromachi shogunate came to count more and more on tax revenues from the merchants in Kyoto rather than from goryosho, due to the poor and unsteady business performance of goryosho caused by a wave of wars.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 納銭方を「料所」と呼称したのもその反映であったとされる。
sen.e: It is said that Goryosho is underlying reason the word 'ryosho' was used to describe Nosenkata (a tax collector.)
That was apparently an underlying reason why the word 'ryosho' was used to describe Nosenkata (a tax collector).
sen.cmt: 前半を修正しました。ピリオドを括弧の外に出しました。
sen.e: That was apparently an underlying reason why the word 'ryosho' was used to describe Nosenkata (a tax collector).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、山城国守護職を幕府の侍所所司などの要職者に宛がって短期間で交代させた。
sen.e: The Muromachi shogunate delegated important figures in government such as Samurai-dokoro Shoshi to the military governor of Yamashiro Province on a shirt-term basis.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Also, the Muromachi shogunate delegated, on a short-term basis, the post of the military governor of Yamashiro Province to people who already occupied important roles in government such as Samurai-dokoro Shoshi.
sen.cmt: Also, および the post of そして who already occupied を追記しました。the post of the military governor of Yamashiro Province と people who already occupied important roles in government such as Samurai-dokoro Shoshi を入れ替えました。shirt-term を short-term に修正し、何を短期間でどうするのかを明確にするため、the post の前に移動しました。
sen.e: Also, the Muromachi shogunate delegated, on a short-term basis, the post of the military governor of Yamashiro Province to people who already occupied important roles in government such as Samurai-dokoro Shoshi.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そうすることで守護領国制の形成を阻止するとともに、その経済的得分の一部を確保していた。
sen.e: By doing that the shogunate was able to restrain them from forming Shugo-ryogoku system, and also secured some economic profit from them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In doing so the shogunate was able to restrain them from forming a Shugo-ryogoku system (the system whereby a Shugo dominates a manor), and also secured some economic profit from them.
sen.cmt: By doing that In doing so に修正しました。(the system whereby a Shugo dominates a manor) を追記しました。
sen.e: In doing so the shogunate was able to restrain them from forming a Shugo-ryogoku system (the system whereby a Shugo dominates a manor), and also secured some economic profit from them.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 中世戦国時代_(日本)における毛利氏の場合、石見銀山を名目上”禁裏御料”とすることで、時の政権（豊臣氏）の干渉を免れていた様である。
sen.e: In Sengoku period Mori clan was able to avoid intervention by the governing clan at that time (namely Toyotomi clan) by registering Iwami Ginzan Silver Mine officially as "Imperial property."
sen.cmt: 文中に（ ）の文章があるため、わかりにくくなっていましたので、( ）の文は文章の終わりにつけました。
sen.e: During the Sengoku period the Mori clan was able to avoid intervention by the ruling clan at that time (namely the Toyotomi clan) by registering Iwami Ginzan Silver Mine officially as "Imperial property."
sen.cmt: In を During the に修正しました。the Mori clan に修正しました。governing clan を regime に修正しました。
sen.e: During the Sengoku period the Mori clan was able to avoid intervention by the ruling clan at that time (namely the Toyotomi clan) by registering Iwami Ginzan Silver Mine officially as "Imperial property."
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: （もちろん朝廷への経済的援助を伴う。)
sen.e: (As a matter of course, it was necessary for Mori clan to offer financial support to the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: 文の終わりにつけた（ ）内の文章。
sen.e: (As a matter of course, it was necessary for the Mori clan to offer financial support to the Imperial Court.)
sen.cmt: the を追記しました。split sample に従い、文末に) を追記し、() でとじられるようにしました。
sen.e: (As a matter of course, it was necessary for the Mori clan to offer financial support to the Imperial Court.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: (上杉氏と毛利氏は、戦国期の皇室援助の2大功労者である。）
sen.e: Uesugi clan and Mori clan are the two largest contributors to Imperial family in the Sengoku period.)
sen.cmt: 文の終わりにつけた（ ）内の文章。
sen.e: The Uesugi clan and the Mori clan were the two largest contributors to the Imperial family in the Sengoku period.)
sen.cmt: the を３つ追記しました。Were に修正しました。split sample に従い、文頭に (を追記し、() でとじられるようにしました。
sen.e: The Uesugi clan and the Mori clan were the two largest contributors to the Imperial family in the Sengoku period.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし
